oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We should not allow a maiden to snap her fingers at us; the wrath of the Rain against us being thereby aroused. In the Katkop dialect, by D !kw in (L V.
5622, 5624). An account of the maiden who snaps her fingers at the people, which makes the rain 'lighten' and try to kill them. The rain 'shoots' at the people when the girl shouts at them.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The maiden who snaps her fingers at the rain (and causes lightning)
